alert.note: Alert for South and East Jackson, Larimer, North and Northeast Grand, Northwest Boulder Counties Above 9000 Feet; South and Southeast Grand, West Central and Southwest Boulder, Gilpin, Clear Creek, Summit, North and West Park Counties Above 9000 Feet; West Jackson and West Grand Counties Above 9000 Feet (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 02 at 5:44AM MST until January 03 at 12:00AM MST by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...SNOW CONTINUES IN THE MOUNTAINS WITH SNOW AND FREEZING DRIZZLE OVER THE PLAINS AND URBAN CORRIDOR TODAY... .Areas of freezing drizzle can be expected across the plains, I-25 Corridor, and Foothills this morning. By the afternoon, snow showers are expected to return to most areas and increase in coverage once again. Slick travel can be expected at times due to the snow and locally light ice accumulations, including for both the morning and evening commutes. Snow will taper off for the urban corridor and mountains in the late afternoon and evening respectively, however will linger through tonight in the northeast plains. ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL MIDNIGHT MST TONIGHT... * WHAT...Snow ongoing. Additional snow accumulations between 3 and 7 inches expected. * WHERE...Rabbit Ears Pass, Rocky Mountain National Park and the Medicine Bow Range, and The Mountains of Summit County, the Mosquito Range, and the Indian Peaks. This includes the I-70 corridor and Eisenhower Tunnel. * WHEN...After a lull this morning, more snow will redevelop this afternoon and continue through this evening. Snow will taper in intensity late tonight, but snow showers will continue through Tuesday night. * IMPACTS...Snow covered roads will make travel hazardous.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions for Colorado can be obtained by calling 5 1 1 or by going to www.cotrip.org.
